text: I actually uh to be totally recursive
about it I just wrote a couple of blogs
about why I blogged um I did it
initially because I just wanted to sort
of feel what it was like I I've always
had this belief and this is what I wrote
the first of the two blogs on
that there really two ways to learn
things one is in a more sort of school
likee atmosphere which is a you know
somebody with more information imparts
that information to you whether in a
classroom or via a book or if you're
grown up in the business world you go
out and you hire McKenzie and they write
you a 100 page uh beautiful report on
the social phenomenon and economic model
of logging and social media you read it
you underline a bit you think you pay
too much but for that moment you sort of
feel like you get it but you don't
really know the Contours because you've
just essentially read somebody else's
work you you're not able to integrate
that into your worldview the other way
of doing it and it's so simple you know
I couldn't go out and wouldn't want to
go out and build a nuclear bomb but um
it isn't that hard to go out to any one
of of the various sites and create your
own blog and do it and interact with
people and see what people are
interested in and how do you post
comments and how do you review them and
um how do you uh sort of incorporate
that into your into your next work and
so I just started doing it to learn by
doing and then along the way I
discovered actually I liked it I was
going to do it in a different way than
let's say traditional if one could even
say there's such a thing as traditional
blogging so so young in its in its life
but most bloggers who are professional
bloggers are doing it almost with
Twitter rapidity you know multiple posts
a day because they're trying to drive
traffic and people are supposed to come
look at it and obviously if you only
post once every couple of weeks you're
not going to have much to monetize uh uh
advertising against but I'm not doing it
for that purpose so I only write when
there's a a intersection of a when I
have time and B when I feel I have
something to say and I I don't have I
don't feel I have something to say uh
more than once or twice a month so
that's how I evolved into the current
position
